meanings.definition: The state or quality of being relative.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the relativities of time helps us appreciate its fluid nature.
meanings.sent2: She considered the relativities of success and happiness before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The relativities of size became a funny topic of discussion at the party.
meanings.sent4: In the vast universe, our planet's relativities seem insignificant.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the colorful relativities of emotions.

meanings.definition: A particular aspect or point of view in relation to something else.
meanings.sent1: From his relativities, the situation seemed much clearer.
meanings.sent2: The relativities of history often depend on who is telling the story.
meanings.sent3: Her relativities on fashion always lead to interesting outfit choices.
meanings.sent4: The relativities of culture can shape our understanding of the world.
meanings.sent5: Exploring different relativities can broaden our perspective on life.
